name: Leg Press (Wide Stance)
how_to_perform:
1. Sit at a leg press machine and position your feet shoulder-width apart on the platform with a wide stance.
2. Adjust the machine to fit your body size, ensuring that your legs are in line with the footrest and your back is against the seat.
3. Push your back into the seat and tense your abdominal muscles to maintain a stable posture throughout the exercise.
4. Extend your feet away from you on the platform, pressing down on it and straightening your legs fully.
5. Lower the platform by releasing the weight stack until your legs are bent at an angle of about 45-60 degrees or slightly less (depending on how hard you want to work).
6. Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement and then push the platform back up to the starting position using your quadriceps, hamstrings, glutes, and calves.
7. Repeat for the desired number of repetitions.
short_summary: Leg press is a lower body exercise that primarily targets the quads, hamstrings, and glutes with added assistance from the legs when done in a wide stance.
